Class FinancialHistory

  • java.lang.Object
    • FinancialHistory

  • public class FinancialHistory
extends java.lang.Object
    The class FinancialHistorycreates objects that reflect the history of incomes from different sources and expenditures for different reasons. The totals for money on hand and for each source of income and each reason of expenditure are available.

    This class is taken from
    Adele Goldberg, David Robson: Smalltalk-80 The Language and its implementation
    Addison-Wesley, 1983

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      FinancialHistory()
      Begin a financial history with 0 as the amount of money at hand.

    • Constructor Detail

      • FinancialHistory

        public FinancialHistory()
        Begin a financial history with 0 as the amount of money at hand.

    • Method Detail

      • initialBalance

        public static FinancialHistory initialBalance(double amount)
        Begin a financial history with amount as the amount of money at hand. Only positive amounts are acceptable.
        Parameters:
        amount - initial amount of money at hand
        Returns:
        new financial history
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - illegal amount

      • receiveFrom

        public void receiveFrom(java.lang.String source,
               double amount)
        Remember that an amount of money, amount, has been received from source. amount must not be negative.
        Parameters:
        source - where the income comes from
        amount - amount of income
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - illegal amount

      • spendFor

        public void spendFor(java.lang.String reason,
            double amount)
        Remember that an amount of money, amount, has been spent for reason. amount must not be negative and debts are not allowed.
        Parameters:
        reason - reason for the expenditure
        amount - money spent
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - for illegal expenditures

      • cashOnHand

        public double cashOnHand()
        Answer the total amount of money currently on hand.
        Returns:
        current amount of money on hand

      • totalReceivedFrom

        public double totalReceivedFrom(java.lang.String source)
        Answer the total amount received from source so far. If source is the empty string the result is the amount received from any source.
        Parameters:
        source - source of income
        Returns:
        total amount received from source

      • totalReceived

        public double totalReceived()
        Answer the total income.
        Returns:
        total income

      • totalSpentFor

        public double totalSpentFor(java.lang.String reason)
        Answer the total amount spent for reason so far. If reason is the empty string the result is the amount spent for any reason.
        Parameters:
        reason - reason for expenditure
        Returns:
        total amount spent for reason

      • totalSpent

        public double totalSpent()
        Answer the total amount spent spent so far.
        Returns:
        total amount spent so far.
